results.title: Playing with numbers (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The main part of this program concerns an examination of the types of numbers that arise. Rational numbers, algebraic numbers and irrational numbers are illustrated and discussed.

results.title: Playing with fire
results.creator_credit: Michael Law and Central Office of Information Film For The Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: Various situations where accidents occur when children are left unsupervised such as pulling a pot of boiling liquid from a stove, reaching to close to a fire without a guard.

results.title: Playing together
results.brief_description: A light-hearted impression in music, words and pictures of the many different sporting activities enjoyed by young and old throughout Britain. It stresses the need for the opportunities to learn sport and its value as a character-builder. Professional sportsmen throughout the country have the same love of the game and sense of fair play which is acknowledged all over the world. Closing sequences of the film show international teams playing football, epitomising the goodwill which is promoted by sport and sportsmen between people and nations of every land.

results.title: Playful Pluto [silent] [edited version]
results.creator_credit: Joseph Schenck and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon starring Mickey Mouse and Pluto. A series of wacky slapstick comedy scenes as Pluto leads Mickey from one catastrophe to the next, all stemming from a fight with the hose in the backyard.

results.title: Players
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated satire on aggression. Two characters, who look like two famous tennis players play a game of tennis which gradually develops into a battle. (Award: Special Jury Prize, Montreal World Film Festival, 1982)

results.title: Playboy number one
results.brief_description: Off-beat comedy, set aboard a cruise ship, revolving around a french teacher (Willie Howard), and his attempt to find a girlfriend. Cast includes Janet Reade, Louis Sorin, Ruth Leavitt, Charles Slattery, Abe Bronson, Joseph De Villard.

results.title: Play rugby series. No. 10. [Team play]
results.creator_credit: John Rickword, John Dobson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the techniques of good team play for a successful, winning, try-scoring team. Rugby football is a hard physical contact game and players need to act within the ethics and rules of the game, but also must be prepared to take risks within the rules of the game.
